contentencoded:
A new research paper focuses on the so-called “advocacy philanthropy” of the two largest higher education grant-makers in this country.


Guest: Cassie Hall, Assistant Director of Admissions at Scripps College and Scott L. Thomas, Associate Dean, School of Educational Studies, Claremont Graduate University.


Read Hall and Thomas’ report, Advocacy Philanthropy and the Public Policy Agenda: The Role of Modern Foundations in American Higher Education.
